tasks.task: Converting harvested corn into ethanol biofuel
subtasks: Drive a combine harvester to harvest corn
Transport corn from the field to the facility
Operate a grinder to grind the corn into kernels
Mix the ground corn with water to create a slurry
Load the slurry into a fermentation tank
Monitor and manage the fermentation process
Separate the ethanol from the fermentation residue
Purify the ethanol through distillation
Distribute the produced ethanol to storage tanks
Clean and maintain equipment after operations
Remove manure from the pig stalls
Collect and mix feed ingredients for the pigs
Prepare feed by adding necessary supplements
Distribute feed to pig stalls
Monitor pig behavior and health
Clean and disinfect pig stalls between feedings
Prepare the soil by tilling and fertilizing
Plant corn seeds using a planter machine
Apply herbicides to control weeds
Irrigate the corn field as needed
Monitor corn growth and development
Apply pesticides for disease and insect control
Operate the combine to cut and thresh the corn
Load harvested corn into the combine's auger
Empty the combine's bin at the storage facility
Transfer ground corn to a mixing tank
Measure and add the correct amount of water
Mix the corn and water thoroughly to form a slurry
Connect the mixing tank to the fermentation tank
Pump the slurry into the fermentation tank
Measure and monitor the slurry level
Check temperature and pH levels regularly
Add necessary adjustments (e.g., enzymes) during fermentation
Assess the progress of ethanol production
Route the fermented mixture to the clarification tank
Use a centrifuge to separate ethanol from the residue
Transfer the separated ethanol to storage containers
Heat the ethanol in a distillation column
Trap and collect the ethanol vapor
Cool the ethanol vapor back into liquid form
Divert impurities from the distillation process
Transfer the purified ethanol via hoses to storage tanks
Ensure the tanks are labeled and secured
Disassemble the combine to clean components
Scrubbing the exterior and interior of the machine
Lubricate moving parts before storing
Use a scoop or loader to collect manure
Transport manure to storage or spreading area
Dispose of manure appropriately
Weigh out the appropriate amounts of corn, soybeans, etc.
Combine different ingredients in a mixer
Add supplements (like minerals or vitamins)
Ensure the feed is uniformly mixed
Drive the equipment to the corn field
Operate the sprayer to apply herbicide
Walk the field to ensure even coverage
Check weather and soil moisture levels
Operate the irrigation system to water the corn
Adjust sprinkler heads or nozzles as needed
Prepare the pesticide mixture in the sprayer
Calibrate the sprayer for effective coverage
Apply pesticide to the corn field according to necessary intervals
